meanings.definition: To have been mawed: to have been eaten or devoured.
meanings.sent1: The delicious pie was mawed by the hungry children in no time.
meanings.sent2: The lion mawed its prey with great satisfaction.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon mawed through the picnic basket, leaving a mess behind.
meanings.sent4: The darkness of the night mawed away the last remnants of daylight.
meanings.sent5: The voracious monster mawed through the entire village, leaving nothing behind.

meanings.definition: Mawed: past tense of maw, meaning to chew or masticate.
meanings.sent1: The cow mawed on the grass lazily in the meadow.
meanings.sent2: The baby eagerly mawed on the teething toy.
meanings.sent3: The old goat mawed on the cud, lost in thought.
meanings.sent4: The machine mawed through the metal with ease.
meanings.sent5: The beaver mawed through the wood to build its dam.

meanings.definition: Mawed: past tense of maw, meaning to consume or devour greedily.
meanings.sent1: The hungry wolves mawed the fresh kill in the moonlight.
meanings.sent2: The child mawed the candy from the jar when no one was looking.
meanings.sent3: The competitive eaters mawed through the hot dogs in record time.
meanings.sent4: The swarm of locusts mawed the crops, leaving devastation in their wake.
meanings.sent5: The wildfire mawed through the forest, leaving a path of destruction.
